meanings.definition: Fitted with a handle or hilt
meanings.sent1: The hafted axe was easy to grip.
meanings.sent2: The sword had a hafted hilt for better control.
meanings.sent3: The hafted knife felt like a trusty companion in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her hafted tools were like extensions of her hands.
meanings.sent5: The hafted hammer was a reliable tool for the job.

meanings.definition: Equipped with a shaft or handle
meanings.sent1: The hafted spear was ready for battle.
meanings.sent2: He preferred hafted tools for their sturdiness.
meanings.sent3: The hafted broom swept the floor with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her hafted fishing rod was essential for a successful catch.
meanings.sent5: The hafted shovel made digging in the garden effortless.

meanings.definition: Attached to a handle or shaft
meanings.sent1: The hafted arrow flew straight towards the target.
meanings.sent2: She admired the craftsmanship of the hafted bow.
meanings.sent3: The hafted rake made yard work more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: His hafted tools were neatly organized in the shed.
meanings.sent5: The hafted axe was a valuable addition to his collection.
